intro: Olea attenuata, commonly known as the narrowleaf olive tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, dark-colored fruits called olives, which are used in various culinary and medicinal applications. Olea attenuata is well adapted to arid and semi-arid climates, making it a resilient plant in Mediterranean environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
